Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of TREO Stent-Graft for Relining AFX in Type 3b Endoleak

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either the TREO stent-graft or standard relining procedures.

Participants.evidence: Conducted at a single surgical center, this randomised controlled trial included patients with type 3b endoleak post-AFX implantation.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either the TREO stent-graft or standard relining procedures.

Objective.evidence: To evaluate the effectiveness of the TREO stent-graft in resolving type 3b endoleaks.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the resolution of the endoleak, assessed by contrast-enhanced CT on postoperative day 5.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not feasible due to the intervention's nature.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The TREO stent-graft successfully resolved the endoleak with no adverse events reported.

Harms.evidence: The TREO stent-graft successfully resolved the endoleak with no adverse events reported.

Funding.evidence: Funding: No funding was reported for this trial.
